title: Knowledge, attitudes and practices regarding tuberculosis in a low-incidence area in the USA.
abstract: Tuberculosis (TB) remains a large global health threat, including increasing cases in generally low-incidence areas of the USA. However, the knowledge, attitudes and practices (KAP) regarding TB in these low-incidence areas are underexplored, precluding planning for effective health communication in these areas regarding travel to high-incidence areas or potential future outbreaks in currently low-incidence areas. Using the health belief model as a theoretical framework, we developed a KAP survey to assess public perceptions of TB in Colorado, a currently low-incidence area.
